channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As beer sales fall, young Germans develop taste for alcohol-free lager
item.description: Non-alcoholic sales have more than doubled in recent years, even though Germany's wider beer market has slumped.

item.title: Life inside notorious 'Alligator Alcatraz' in its final days
item.description: Family members of detainees say their loved ones disappeared into the notorious immigration detention facility.

item.title: Thousands demonstrate across Mexico for the 130,000 missing
item.description: Thousands march through Mexico's cities urging more government action against enforced disappearances - a problem often linked to drug cartels.

item.title: Reeling from Trump's tariffs, India and China seek a business reboot
item.description: India's prime minister hopes to draw nearer to some of the world’s largest economies.

item.title: Kiss of Death and the Google Exec
item.description: The mysterious death of a Google executive and his last night with an exotic beauty captured on video -- now a court decides her fate. "48 Hours" corr...

item.title: Johnson signs executive order against possible deployment of federal agents to Chicago
item.description: The signing of the "Protecting Chicago Initiative" comes amid growing concerns of federal agents arriving in the city as soon as Friday.

item.title: French voice fears over Bayeux Tapestry move to UK
item.description: The precious medieval work is to be displayed in London next year - but the French art world is strongly opposed.

item.title: The millionaire, the model & the hit man: Inside a murder-for-hire-plot
item.description: A Los Angeles millionaire is willing to shell out $80,000 to have someone kill his model wife. What could possibly go wrong?

item.title: Who is Alix Tichelman?
item.description: Meet the tattooed beauty charged in the death of Google executive Forrest Hayes.

item.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $1.1 billion after no winning tickets Saturday
item.description: Monday's estimated $1.1. billion drawing will be the fifth-largest in Powerball history.

item.title: Opinion: It's time to 'move our feet'
item.description: The shooting this week at a Minneapolis Catholic school that killed 2 children won't the be last such incident. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the cycl...

item.title: Photos: Mother Nature must be really annoyed at our fakery
item.description: A polar bear in a zoo, a hotel balcony overlooking elephants, a tree mural shrouded by haze: They're images from the new book The Anthropocene Illusio...

item.title: 139 days: 3 Scottish brothers set a record for fastest row across the Pacific
item.description: Jamie, Ewan and Lachlan Maclean completed the fastest unsupported row across the Pacific, arriving in Cairns, Australia, on Saturday. They rowed over ...

item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy for 2nd time in less than a year
item.description: The budget carrier filed for fresh bankruptcy protection months after emerging from a Chapter 11 reorganization. The airline said it plans to keep fly...

item.title: Houthi rebels say Israeli airstrike killed their prime minister in Yemen's capital
item.description: The Iranian-backed Houthis said an Israeli airstrike killed the prime minister of the rebel-controlled government in the Yemeni capital, Sanaa.

item.title: Montana man who evaded authorities for a week after bar shooting faces four counts of murder
Trump taps federal agents to tackle local policing. That’s not always helpful, critics say
Boy wounded in Minnesota church shooting asks doctor: ‘Can you say a prayer with me?’
item.description: Stories of bravery and heartache are emerging after the deadly shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic church during a Mass celebrating the start of the sc...
